byline.contributor: Susan Beachy contributed research from New York.

abstract: Illegal maritime employment agencies around world recruit workers for fishing and other vessels based on false promises, then abuse and underpay them and return them home in debt, injured and sometimes dead; so-called manning agencies, which employ trickery, debt, fear and violence for their ends, often escape consequences; death of Filipino seaman Eril Andrade after being recruited by Step Up Marine Enterprise exemplifies problem (Series: The Outlaw Ocean).
lead_paragraph: Illegal “manning agencies” trick villagers in the Philippines with false promises of high wages and send them to ships notorious for poor safety and labor records.

headline.main: Tricked and Indebted on Land, Abused or Abandoned at Sea
headline.print_headline: Tricked While on Land, Abused or Killed at Sea

snippet: Illegal “manning agencies” trick villagers in the Philippines with false promises of high wages and send them to ships notorious for poor safety and labor records.
